column5: Is it possible to remove the existing split grip and replace it with a full cork grip?  If so, any recommendations for a good rod builder in the GTA?  TIA
Thanks Albert.  Yes it's definitely doable. If you really feel it's necessary you can PM me.
Well, one good experience leads to another.  (Spiel repaired a rod for me, and I can't tell the difference   )

Hi guys I got to know my neighbour recently who is also a certified custom rod builder ( and fly tieing)..he buys St Croix blanks and goes from there..quite an impressive 'fishing room'...custom inlays, whatever you want/need...he can do it...we are near Barrie/Orillia/Midland..  send me a PM if you need more info or are curious...thanks Rich
